description.narrative: 7.4 Capacities of communities, stakeholders and beneficiaries are strengthened to participate actively in collective action to Â increase demand for and utilization of services, adoption of optimal caregiving/wellbeing practices, abandonment of harmful social norms (e.g. Child Marriage, FGMC, Open Defecation) and humanitarian action by 2019, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 7.0 Improved policy environment and systems for disadvantaged and excluded children, guided by improved knowledge and data by 2019.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 7.4 Capacities of communities, stakeholders and beneficiaries are strengthened to participate actively in collective action to increase demand for and utilization of services, adoption of optimal caregiving/wellbeing practices, abandonment of harmful social norms (e.g. Child Marriage, FGMC, Open Defecation) and humanitarian action by 2019

description.narrative: During the Measles and Rubella Campaign that targeted over 3.2 million children in June 2019, 88.3 per cent of caregivers were aware of the vaccination campaign prior to the day the child received the vaccine resulting to 90 percent of the target receiving the vaccine. The Communication for Development (C4D) campaign ensured that communities and beneficiaries had greater capacity to demand and use services. Communities knowledge about essential family practices improved through listening to interactive radio programmes. The Ministry of Health and Sanitation (MOHS) capacity to rapidly respond to emegencies with communication for development tools improved in 2019. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of chiefdoms with a functional communication and community engagement mechanism to reach affected populations during emergencies.
Number of Government MDAs staff with skills in evidence based communication planning and coordination
Number of sectoral Communication Strategies and social norm strategies in place
Number of Community Action Plans implemented
Percentage of population reached with vaccination social mobilisation messages
Percentage of mothers and caregivers with knowledge of at least 5 essential family practices
Existence of functioning mechanisms for public engagement to influence development agendas in the local, sub-national or national plans that affect the most disadvantaged and marginalized

baseline.value: Public engagement mechanism exists at chiefdom level

target.value: 2019:Functioning public engagement mechanism at national, district and chiefdom levels

actual.value: 2019:Functional public engagement mechanisms available at all levels
